paragraphs.text: We are living in a diverse world. We need products and solutions that serve people from all walks of life. We need diverse founders to create these companies. In a recent New Yorker profile on YC’s President, Sam Altman, YC alumni Sebastian Wallin said, “YC provides instant entrée to Silicon Valley — a community that, despite its meritocratic rhetoric, typically requires a “warm intro” from a colleague, who is usually a white man.”
paragraphs.name: 327e

7e51208ea989.title: Why More Minority Founders Should Apply to Y Combinator

paragraphs.text: Why More Minority Founders Should Apply to Y Combinator
paragraphs.name: bbba

virtuals.subtitle: Y Combinator is looking to increase diversity within technology. That’s why we decided to apply.

content.subtitle: Y Combinator is looking to increase diversity within technology. That’s why we decided to apply.

1c99a515d59.title: Minority refers to being the smaller number or part, especially a number that is less then half the…

paragraphs.text: Minority refers to being the smaller number or part, especially a number that is less then half the whole number. If you would like to discuss, please email me Dave@getsquire.com
paragraphs.name: 90fc

db6b8abd6571.title: As a fellow minority, struggling to find his place in the tech community, I applaud you for being…

paragraphs.text: As a fellow minority, struggling to find his place in the tech community, I applaud you for being brave enough to weather the storms of entrepreneurship and dive into uncharted territory. I can’t tell you the number of times I’ve felt out of place, in school, at meet ups, or online, but truthfully, the higher up the ladder I go, the less colorful it…

6aeb7a5482fe.title: By all means, apply to Y Combinator. Its not that hard to do and you don’t have anything to lose.

paragraphs.text: By all means, apply to Y Combinator. Its not that hard to do and you don’t have anything to lose.
We at nderground applied to Y Combinator and didn’t get in. Getting into Y Combinator is about twice as hard, statistically, as getting into an Ivy League school. Just to set expectations.

c06802a4a7e9.title: Neat. Is this before, or after, YC partner Peter Thiel welcomes minority founders with the Trump…

paragraphs.text: Neat. Is this before, or after, YC partner Peter Thiel welcomes minority founders with the Trump stump “get the fuck out of the country?” pep talk? Asking for a friend.
paragraphs.name: 697e

64ae6ee4fc22.title: What the hell is a minority?

paragraphs.text: What the hell is a minority? Who goes around calling themselves a “minority”, seriously? Is that how YC refer to you guys as “minorities” and you accepted the moniker? I’m a black man and if I want to apply to the YC or they want me to apply, then they need to ask me as a black man to apply, not referring to me as a minority. That’s weird you would…
paragraphs.name: cb3c

virtuals.subtitle: Praising or name-dropping YC is just you saying you didn’t know how to approach your customer base directly and grow a business…

content.subtitle: Praising or name-dropping YC is just you saying you didn’t know how to approach your customer base directly and grow a business…

e2f872d4feda.title: Counterpoint: Do you really want to be the people getting treated differently because of your race?

paragraphs.text: Counterpoint: Do you really want to be the people getting treated differently because of your race? That is still discrimination. If my product/idea can’t stand on its own merits without my race coming in then it’s obviously not ready. If my community isn’t applying then there’s obviously a grassroots issue. I don’t think this solves anything except…

fd7ce6a89ef6.title: Great article — wish you luck in your future endeavors!

paragraphs.text: Great article — wish you luck in your future endeavors!
paragraphs.name: a79f

paragraphs.text: That’s a non-sequitur. You want diverse founders, there is no necessity. What we need is talented founders to create those products and solutions.
paragraphs.name: 6bf5

paragraphs.text: It would be nice if the demographics of founders matched up with the general population, but I have seen no evidence that suggests diversity is a separate requirement for creating successful companies.
paragraphs.name: b84b
